high.mackenzie.autumn.lang.compiler.compilers

Class VariableScope

  • java.lang.Object
    • high.mackenzie.autumn.lang.compiler.compilers.VariableScope

  • public final class VariableScope
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of this class provides the logic necessary to allocate local variables.

    Note: Parameters must be declared *before* declaring any other local-variables.

    • Field Summary

      static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,IType> lang_testing_info

    • Field Detail

      • lang_testing_info

        public static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,IType> lang_testing_info
        This map maps the names of variables to their types. This map is used to assist in testing of the language.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VariableScope

        public VariableScope(VariableScope closes_over,
             int initial_address)
        Sole Constructor.
        Parameters:
        closes_over - is the scope that the new scope closes-over, or null, if the new scope does not close over another scope.
        initial_address - indicates the address of the first allocated variable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if initial_address < 0.

    • Method Detail

      • declareParameter

        public void declareParameter(Variable variable,
                    IExpressionType type)
        This method declares and allocates a new local-variable that is a parameter.
        Parameters:
        variable - is an AST-node that represents the variable to declare.
        type - is the proposed static-type of the variable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if any non-parameter locals were already declared.

      • declareVar

        public boolean declareVar(Variable variable,
                 IExpressionType type)
        This method declares and allocates a new local-variable.
        Parameters:
        variable - is an AST-node that represents the variable to declare.
        type - is the proposed static-type of the variable.
        Returns:
        true, if declaration was successful.

      • declareVal

        public boolean declareVal(Variable variable,
                 IExpressionType type)
        This method declares and allocates a new local-variable that is readonly.
        Parameters:
        variable - is an AST-node that represents the variable to declare.
        type - is the proposed static-type of the variable.
        Returns:
        true, if declaration was successful.

      • isDeclared

        public boolean isDeclared(java.lang.String name)
        This method determines whether a named variable was already declared.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the variable to search for.
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, the named variable was already allocated.

      • isClosureVariable

        public boolean isClosureVariable(java.lang.String name)
        This method determines whether a named variable was inherited from an outer scope.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the variable to search for.
        Returns:
        true, if the variable was obtained via a closure.

      • isParameter

        public boolean isParameter(java.lang.String name)
        This method determines whether a named variable is a formal-parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the variable to search for.
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, the named variable is a formal-parameter.

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly(java.lang.String name)
        This method determines whether a named variable allows non-initializer assignments.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the variable.
        Returns:
        true, if and only if, the variable can be repeatedly assigned to.

      • addressOf

        public int addressOf(java.lang.String name)
        This method retrieves the address of a previously declared variable.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the variable.
        Returns:
        the address of the variable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the variable was not previously declared in this scope.

      • typeOf

        public IVariableType typeOf(java.lang.String name)
        This method retrieves the static-type type of a named variable.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the variable.
        Returns:
        the static-type of the variable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the variable was not previously declared.

      • outerScope

        public VariableScope outerScope()
        This method retrieves the scope that this scope closes over.
        Returns:
        the scope that this scope forms a closure over, or null, if this scope does not close over any other scope.

      • getVariables

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getVariables()
        This method creates a set containing the names of every variable in this exact scope.
        Returns:
        the names of every variable declared directly in this scope.

      • getAllVariables

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllVariables()
        This method creates a set containing the names of every variable in this scope.
        Returns:
        the names of every variable declared directly or indirectly in this scope.

      • description

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> description()
        This method returns strings which describe the variables accessible within this scope.

        The strings are sorted lexicographically.

        Format: depth 00000 address 00000 form name : type

        Returns:
        the aforedescribed list of strings.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
